author: redbeardlegoman
title: How much is that doggy in the window?  $4?  Deal!
review:
As a whole, I can't say that this is my favourite.  And that's hard for me to admit, because I love the CMF, and am very forgiving.

However, I do get a new top to use around town, and a face, too.

The bread is good.  I like the bread.  Maybe the Bricklink price will stay kinda low on them, should I ever decide to build a Bakery MOC.

But that Frenchie!  Squee!  I would have bought this one no matter what it was to get that Frenchie!  

TLG, you've got a lot of dogs out now.  Generic mutts, chihuahuas, German Sheppards, and West Highland White Terriers.  May I please ask for Sheepdogs, British Bulldogs, Akitas and Great Danes?

author: Odeinoichus
title: A Stereotype makes for a poor offering.
review:
Set #71018 Connoisseur: How boring can you be? That's what some folks think of this Minifigure, I, however, look at him and see more of a stereotype than I'd care to. From the baguette in his hand to the large red necktie/scarf deal and the French Beret I think of this guy as truly a non-PC figure.

If it weren't for the new animal piece included with him I'd feel like LEGO may have made a slight mistake in releasing someone like him. He's wearing a black and white striped shirt also, not to be confused with a LEGO City prisoner costume, this is another element of the stereotypical French Connoisseur.

Am I being too harsh with this Review? do forgive me, but honestly, this is one of the weakest offerings from Series 17, sure the dog is a great addition to LEGO animals, much like the Rabbit, but this figure is somewhat bland, perpetuates a Stereotype that Hollywood made popular in French comedies, though I'm certain it's been around longer than that, and it just feels like a step in the wrong direction for LEGO. Of course my French-Canadian side may be a bit biased towards this figure, do forgive me.

I would recommend him for the novelty alone I suppose, if it doesn't bother you too badly. Also the dog is a great new piece and just as cute as the rabbit or the little Chihuahua Series 10 introduced for us. Somewhat recommended.

author: Brickstarr
title: BONJOUR!!!
review:
Today I will be reviewing the collectible minifigure connoisseur ( set 71018-9) he comes with 6 pieces and retailed for £3 or $4.

I will just say this is probably my favorite LEGO minifigure ever, I just love the way he looks.

He comes with black trousers and a shirt that is black and white and is striped and has a red cravat. He has a puzzled face with a curly mustache and a black beret. The accessories he comes with are a pug and a delicious looking baguette.

Thanks for reading 

I hope it was helpful :-)

author: monkyby87
title: Fun figure with a great dog accessory!
review:
This Connoisseur is a fun mini-figure.  The shirt isn't super exciting, but it's a neat print.  The face printing is fun as well, and could be used in several different themes.  The bread piece is nothing new, but the dog piece is the real winner.  The little French bulldog is very cute and is a great addition to the mini-figure line of animals.  

I definitely recommend this figure.  Sure, he might be a stereotypical French guy, but all of the mini-figures are stereotypical in a sense.  That's the whole point.  This is a very neat figure.

author: Lobo_da_boss_
title: Not the largest fan of the breed but still nice
review:
Opening;

The connoisseur is a fun figure that was my most wanted of the series . 

The Minifigure -

The figure has a hat which is nice and can work when facing other directions , a face with fine moustache and a peculiar mouth , a nice torso with finely printed arms and the end suffer from the same problem as the professional surfer of the series as the are as plain as possible being unprinted .

The accessories -

His accessories include a non exclusive but very nice baguette and a French blog which was a new piece for the time . The stand is the standard black CMF stand .

In conclusion -

this is a figure I yearned for back in 2017 but today me prefers the rocket not figure but I still do quite like it a bit more than the other 3 below so I recommend it .
